# Arpeggio - Add2 in A# (Shape: D)

An arpeggio is the playing of the individual notes of a chord in succession, creating a broken chord instead of playing them simultaneously. In this specific arpeggio, we are focusing on the Add2 chord structure in the key of A# (A sharp) with the shape based on the D chord formation.

## Notes and Intervals
- A# (Root)
- C# (Major 3rd)
- D# (Add2)
- F# (Perfect 5th)

The intervals in this arpeggio give it a unique and rich sound due to the presence of the added 2nd (D#) note, which adds color and flavor to the typical major chord structure.

## Musical Flavor and Genre
This arpeggio, with the Add2 variation, brings in an ethereal and dreamy quality to the music. The added 2nd note introduces a sense of tension and resolution, creating a mystical and enchanting atmosphere in the music it is incorporated into.

The Add2 arpeggio in A# is often used in genres like ambient music, dream pop, and jazz where a more introspective and emotive sound is desired. It can add a touch of sophistication and complexity to compositions in these genres.

2. **"Cherry" by Chromatics**: In this dream pop song, the Add2 arpeggio in A# adds to the overall ethereal and hypnotic atmosphere.
